TopicTitle: Post your KSP community goodness here!!!!!

Articles.Content:
Hey guys!

Some of you probably know me already but for those who don't my name is Pleborian, KSP Media group affectionado

As some of you guys will have noticed, the media group have taken over the duties of writing the KSP weekly's (Overseen by Cpt. Skunky) which we bring you every Tuesday from here until the end of time!

So why are am I writing this big long description about things you already know? Well, for me personally I believe the best section of the weekly is the community spotlight, this is the place where we take the greatest things some of you guys have done and show them off to the whole Kerbal world... There is a lot of great stuff here on the forums but also spread in the far reaches of the interwebs, and its my job to find it and show it off.

In the pages below I need you guys to post EVERYTHING Kerbal related you have ever found, anything you believe is exceptional in every way and deserves to have a little spot on the weekly

These can be anything from:

- Craft files

- Mods

- Screenshots

- Fan art

- Videos

- Narratives (such as Kerbal themed stories and fiction)

- Kerbal music

- And a whole lot more of exciting stuff that I am not aware of

If you are a fan of someones work, let us know... there is so much good stuff out there that 1 or 2 people looking for it is like looking for that one booster that wont explode in a stack big enough top fill a football field.

Lets show the world the power of the KSP community!

Peace!

Pleborian

(Youtube and media group type guy)

Edited May 22, 2013 by Pleborian

He's been mentioned before on here so I know I'm not the only to watch his videos but Chickenkeeper24 needs a shout out. I found his youtube channel when looking at Minecraft animations (he's got some new ones out btw). Having subscribed I saw his Kerbal Space Program videos' and was instantly hooked, downloaded the demo and purchased the game.

His permadeath series is definately worth tracking in the KSP weekly's.

One of your many procrastinauts here . I remember the shout-out you gave me in August for Cyclone Aerospace. Thanks again! Anyways, I believe The Grand Tour- Voyage To The Planets, an AAR by czokletmuss, should get a shout-out. He inspired many including me to start our own stories based off of missions we have done in KSP.

I think that the following deserve to be put in the KSP Weekly's.

Project Babylon: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/26150-Project-BABYLON

Laythe Mission: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/27552-Long-term-Laythe-Mission-(pic-heavy)-Now-with-**PART-5**

Hope you don't mind if I post the pic directly:

*Insert kerplow advertisment here*

Now with 50% more kerplowness!!
I just came across this
Katateochi's, well, everything is good, but my favorites are the Mun disco and war robot FRANK. https://www.youtube.com/user/katateochi?feature=watch

I definitely think that FizziksGuy and his high school science class should get a bit of exposure, if they haven't already.

KSP in a High School Physics Class
